questiontext.text:
Evaluate the sum of the infinite series :
$$\small \sum _{n=1}^{\infty }\:[-5(\frac{1}{2})^n-3(3)^{2n}]$$

[Calculate upto 2 significant figures]

Answer :
{1:NUMERICAL:=-5.375:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
This contains two geometric series where the following is given :
First term : a1 = a2[At n=0 , the first term for both the series will be to the power 0 which equals 1]
Common ratios : r1 = $$\small \frac{1}{2}$$ ,r2 = $$\small \frac{1}{9}$$
Number of terms(n) = $$\small \infty$$

The Sum of a Geometric series is given by :
$$\small \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r}$$ where a is the first term , r is the common difference and n is the number of terms

As n = $$\small \infty$$, Sum = $$\small \frac{a}{1 - r}$$
Sum1 = $$\small \frac{a}{1 - r_{1}}$$ ; Sum2 = $$\small \frac{a}{1 - r_{2}}$$
Sum1 = 1  Sum2 = 0.125

Total Sum = (-5) * Sum1 + (-3) * Sum2
Total Sum = -5.375

$$\small \sum _{n=1}^{\infty }\:[(25)^{-\frac{n}{2}}+5(\frac{1}{9})^n]$$

[Calculate upto 2 significant figures]

Answer :
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.875:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
This contains two geometric series with first term a = 1 and common ratios $$\small \frac{1}{5}$$ and $$\small \frac{1}{9}$$ respectively.
Number of terms n = $$ \small \infty$$
Sum = $$\small \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r}$$
Sum =  0.875

questiontext.text:
Evaluate the sum of the infinite series :
$$\small \sum _{n=2}^{\infty }\:[5(\frac{1}{2})^n-4(\frac{1}{10})^n]$$

[Calculate upto 2 significant figures]

Answer :
{1:NUMERICAL:=2.4556:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
This contains two geometric series where the following is given :
First term : a1 = a2[At n=0 , the first term for both the series will be to the power 0 which equals 1]
Common ratios : r1 = $$\small \frac{1}{2}$$ ,r2 = $$\small \frac{1}{10}$$
Number of terms(n) = $$\small \infty$$

The Sum of a Geometric series is given by :
$$\small \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r}$$ where a is the first term , r is the common difference and n is the number of terms

As n = $$\small \infty$$, Sum = $$\small \frac{a}{1 - r}$$
Sum1 = $$\small \frac{a}{1 - r_{1}}$$ ; Sum2 = $$\small \frac{a}{1 - r_{2}}$$
Sum1 = 0.5  Sum2 = 0.011111

Total Sum = (5) * Sum1 + (-4) * Sum2
Total Sum = 2.4556
